thread.title: Brett Stegmaier takes 1-shot lead in Las Vegas
thread.title_full: Brett Stegmaier takes 1-shot lead in Las Vegas

title: Brett Stegmaier takes 1-shot lead in Las Vegas
text:
Brett Stegmaier takes 1-shot lead in Las Vegas - FOX5 Vegas - KVVU Member Center: Brett Stegmaier takes 1-shot lead in Las Vegas Posted: By MICHAEL MARTINEZAssociated Press 
LAS VEGAS (AP) - Brett Stegmaier birdied the final hole for a 3-under 68 and a one-stroke lead Saturday in the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open. 
Making his fifth career PGA Tour start, Stegmaier rebounded from a bogey on the par-3 17th with a 13-foot birdie putt on the par-4 18th to reach 13-under 68. The 32-year-old former University of Florida player completed a second-round 66 on Saturday morning for a share of the lead. 
Morgan Hoffman was second after a 66. After making four birdies in a four-hole stretch, he hooked his drive on 18 into the desert rocks and ended up saving bogey with a 10-foot putt. 
Jimmy Walker, former UNLV player Chad Campbell and 2011 winner Kevin Na were tied for third at 11 under. Walker had a 69, Na shot 68, and Campbell 70. Copyright 2015 The Associated Press.   This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
